card.title: Kælis The Crypto Ring
card.description: Screenless wearable enabling secure, offline crypto payments through gestures.

case.title: A Tap Away from Freedom: The Design Behind Kælis
case.summary: Traditional crypto wallets rely on screens, seed phrases, and connectivity—making them slow, stressful, and impractical in high-risk environments. Kælis reimagined this experience as a discreet wearable ring that enables secure, offline payments and decentralised identity through simple gestures. I led the end-to-end design, from research to prototyping, building a proof-of-concept that blends security with usability. The result: a screenless, ambient interaction model where users complete payments and recover wallets faster, with less cognitive strain.

context.title: Context
context.text: Kælis was developed as an independent initiative exploring the intersection of Web3 and IoT wearables. The project targeted urban, privacy-conscious users and individuals operating in high-risk or low-connectivity environments.The objective was to validate whether cold-wallet-grade security could be achieved in a form factor as discreet and intuitive as a ring.

problems.title: Problems
problems.text: Existing crypto wallets are cumbersome: they demand technical fluency, constant network access, and reliance on seed phrases. Users reported frustration with complexity and anxiety over coercion or loss of access. The challenge was to design a product that felt as effortless as tapping a metro card, while meeting strict privacy and security standards.

approach.title: Approach
approach.text: I conducted 15 in-depth interviews across three user archetypes to map trust triggers, mental models, and threat scenarios. From this, I modelled the ring's behaviour as a finite-state machine, mapping gestures (tap, triple-tap, sequences) to system states. I prototyped with Arduino rigs, capacitive sensors, and 3D-printed rings to test gesture reliability, latency, and haptic feedback. I also designed a companion app for setup and recovery, abstracting blockchain complexity into clear, fiat-like flows.

solution.title: Solution
solution.text: Kælis delivered a gesture-driven wearable and a minimal companion app that together enabled offline payments, seedless recovery, and coercion resistance. The ring used a Secure Element to sign transactions locally, while gestures triggered states like Ghost Mode or Wipe. The app supported initial setup, backup to a trusted device, and transparent state reflection—without ever exposing seed phrases or raw keys. This combination balanced security, usability, and resilience, showing that crypto tools can be both human-centred and tamper-resistant.

items.caption: Core app screens for setup, recovery, and state feedback—clarity without crypto jargon.
Kaelis ring with Secure Element, NFC, and touch sensors for offline gesture control.
Seedless onboarding through secure ring pairing—simple, clear, and stress-free.
